meanings.sent1: The story was so interesting that it became a speakable topic among friends.
meanings.sent2: In class, the teacher asked us to discuss only speakable things.
meanings.sent3: The cat thought it was speakable to meow during the movie, making everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: The beauty of the sunset was so speakable that no words were needed to describe it.
meanings.sent5: Her kindness was speakable through her actions, touching everyone's hearts.

meanings.definition: Able to be expressed in words
meanings.sent1: The complex idea was not easily speakable to the students.
meanings.sent2: Feelings of love are often difficult to put into speakable terms.
meanings.sent3: The speakable emotions of joy and excitement filled the room during the surprise party.
meanings.sent4: His talent for music was so speakable that it resonated with everyone who heard him play.
meanings.sent5: The beauty of nature is truly speakable, inspiring poets and artists alike.
